ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Straighten LETG/HRC-S spectra by applying tg_d adjustments.

DESC.PARA: &cltool; reads in a standard LETG/HRC-S evt2 file and adjusts the TG_D values of all events to remove small "wiggles" and straighten the dispersed spectrum. The adjustments, which are up to +/-1.5 HRC pixels, are applied on a tap-by-tap (CRSV) basis along the dispersion axis and correct small residual errors that cannot be corrected by the HRC-S degapping procedure. Only TG_D values are affected; the output file will not exhibit any changes if displayed in sky or detector coordinates.

&cltool; is generally used in combination with the detilt and symmetrize commands--also contributed software tools--to prepare LETG/HRC-S spectra so that narrower spectral extraction regions can be used to improve the S/N of low-S/N data.
Run the program with the clobber parameter enabled.
Input FITS file event list with columns CHIP_ID, CHIPY and TG_D.
Output FITS file event list with modified TG_D column.
Wiggle correction file, containing TG_D correction as a function of CRSV.
Controls the amount of information tool prints to the screen.
